page.title: 03TRANSPORT IN BOWERCHALKE
page.content: PRIVATE TRANSPORT One farmer has a private plane 78 Households (out of 140) have 1 car 25 Households have 2 cars 3 Households have motor bikes 5 Households use bicycles (apart from children) PUBLIC TRANSPORT There is a privately owned bus service subsidised by the Wilts. County Council, on weekdays. This provides 6 buses daily to Salisbury, the last bus returning at 5.40pm, except on Fridays - l0.30pm: 1 bus daily continues to Shaftesbury & villages intermediately, an extra one running on market day.No buses run on Sundays. Except for business people, very few residents use buses; the bus service serves 66% of the village only. It is dearer than car transport; some car owners give lifts but buses are a useful reserve.
